Package com.game.myGame

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
com.game.myGame.Level
com.game.myGame.Menu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Menu
extends Level
This class represents the Menu. A Menu is an extension of the Level and it displays a background image, three options (new game, options, exit) that allows the player to start the game, modify certains parametres or to exit the game.
Author:
MatteoValerio
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Menu

      public Menu​(GameFrame frame, java.lang.String name)
      The public constructor. It calls the superclass constructor before initialize the graphical aspect of the Menu.
      Parameters:
      frame - The GameFrame that manages this Menu

  • Method Details

    • init

      private void init()
      This private method is build to have a cleaner view of the code. In this method all the graphical aspects of the Menu are initialized and also it is set all the KeyBindings for setting up the controls that the user can do. It is also called a method to load the background and to initialize the audio.

    • viewTutorial

      private void viewTutorial()
      It sets the variable isMenu to false so the tutorial is displayed.

    • loadBackground

      private void loadBackground()
      In this method it's build the image that will be displayed as background in the Menu

    • addKeyBinding

      private void addKeyBinding​(javax.swing.JComponent comp, int keyCode, java.lang.String id, java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
      This private method is build to display easily the code in the init() method. Here we associate some actions that we want to happen if a certain key is pressed.
      Parameters:
      comp - The JComponent from which we want to act the focus. In this case it will be the Menu.
      keyCode - The key code correspondent to the the key we want to associate
      id - An id we will use as bridge in the map. It is better if that it remembers the name of the key.
      listener - An action listener that will manage the actions associated to the key.

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method overrides the same in JPanel and it allows us to paint in the Menu all the graphical contents.
      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
